. Therefore, signature#getSignatureBindingInfo can retrun null.
I thought of serializing SignatureBindingInfo, but then it appeared that we just need variableArity to fill some fields of the pg_proc, therefore, I've serialized it with a signature object.
replies.author: kovrus

replies.bodyText:
I thought of serializing SignatureBindingInfo, but then it appeared that we just need variableArity to fill some fields of the pg_proc, therefore, I've serialized it with a signature object.

SignatureBindingInfo was created to avoid streaming of information which is only needed for binding/matching of signatured but not needed for resolving a signature to an impl directly against the registry.
Inside the registry, signature#getSignatureBindingInfo is never null.
replies.author: seut

replies.bodyText: To clarify more, variableArity should never be streamed. Can you please elaborate why you've added streaming support for it?
replies.author: seut

replies.bodyText: I'll remove that. I thought, that it won't be always possible to use Sigmature#getBindingInfo to get variableArity in order to populate the pg_proc table.
